descript.abstract: All day and peak transit 20th, 50th, and 80th percentile speeds on stop segments estimated on a single day for all CA transit operators that provide GTFS real-time vehicle positions data.
descript.purpose: Average all-day, peak, and offpeak transit speeds by segments for all CA operators that provide GTFS real-time vehicle positions data.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Full name of the transit agency

Indicates the direction of travel for a trip. This field should not be used in routing; it provides a way to separate trips by direction when publishing time tables. Valid options are 0 - Travel in one direction (e.g. outbound travel). 1 - Travel in the opposite direction (e.g. inbound travel).
A pair of stops. Identifies the current stop_id and the subsequent stop_id. The stop pair value is created internally by concatenating two stop ids with double underscores.
The 20th percentile speed (mph) for all trips associated with the route_id, direction_id, stop_pair, and time_period.
The 50th percentile speed (mph) for all trips associated with the route_id, direction_id, stop_pair, and time_period.
The 80th percentile speed (mph) for all trips associated with the route_id, direction_id, stop_pair, and time_period.
The number of trips used to find the 20th, 50th, and 80th percentile speeds within the segment.

The time period over which the metric is calculated. Valid options are offpeak - offpeak hours are 12am-6:59am inclusive, 10am-2:59pm inclusive, and 8pm-11:59pm inclusive. peak - peak hours are 7am-9:59am inclusive and 3pm-7:59pm inclusive. all_day
The base64 encoded url for the feed associated with the agency

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
